citation-title.titletext: The weight of reasons: A framework for ethics get access arrow

abstract.publishercopyright: © Oxford University Press 2025 All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: The book develops, defends, and applies a “Dual Scale” model of weighing reasons to resolve various issues in ethics. It tells you everything you ever wanted to know about weighing reasons and probably a lot of stuff you didn’t want to know too. It addresses, among other things, what the general issue of weighing reasons is; what it is to weigh reasons correctly; whether reasons have more than one weight value (e.g., justifying, requiring, and/or commending weight); whether weight values are context sensitive; how to tell what the weights of reasons are; how reasons for are related to reasons against; and how the weights of reasons aggregate. After addressing such issues, it explains a number of puzzling phenomena in ethics, such as the All or Nothing Problem, the normative significance of small improvements, and the intransitivity of the makes-it-permissible-to-act-against relation.

source.sourcetitle: The weight of reasons: a framework for ethics get access arrow
source.sourcetitle-abbrev: The weight. of reasons: a framew. for ethics get access n.a.
